explanation: The agent A report is correct. In digest_get_hash_size the final 'else' arm ends with an expression-statement (void)0; which is executed when none of the prior conditional returns occur, and it has no side effects. Removing that statement would not change the program behaviour (the function still falls through to the subsequent return 0;), so it meets MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.2's definition of dead code (an executed operation whose removal would not affect program behaviour). The presence of the no-op apparently serves only to satisfy syntactic/preprocessor layout, but that does not exempt it from Rule 2.2. A fix is to remove the no-op or restructure the preprocessor/conditional logic so no executed no-op remains.
